snippet: International students make up a higher percentage of incoming students at state schools than in the past, and pay a disproportionate amount of tuition.
abstract: International students make up a higher percentage of incoming students at state schools than in the past, and pay a disproportionate amount of tuition.
lead_paragraph: Our colleague Tamar Lewin wrote a story in Sunday's New York Times about international students paying premium prices to attend colleges in the United States. Ms. Lewin focused on the University of Washington, where 18 percent of freshmen hail from abroad.

headline.main: Foreign Students Pay a Premium at American Colleges
